abstracts.cdata!:
This resettlement action plan aims at
            ensuring that project-affected families (PAFs) are
            compensated for loss of assets, be it land, household,
            business, or temporary income. Specific recommendations
            regarding the right of way were made upon revision of
            engineering designs, to ensure significant socioeconomic
            impacts, and likewise, regarding compliance between the
            country's legal framework, and the Bank's
            operational directives on resettlement issues. Affected
            populations will be compensated with replacement costs for
            agricultural land, and construction of new housing, while
            displacement will aim at preserving community ties, and
            avoid as possible, relocations outside the community. Small
            enterprises and businesses will be compensated for temporary
            losses, and, involuntary resettlement will be conducted
            within legislative procedures as specified for
            appropriations related issues. Resettlement, rehabilitation,
            and compensations will be monitored by PAFs participating in
            the process, and grievance mechanisms will be set up.
